p: In addition, other studies have specifically examined the 2015 Indiana HIV outbreak focusing on uncovering its root causes, specific strategies that could have prevented the outbreak, and modeling whether earlier responses to the outbreak could have had an impact on the number of people infected [ 2, 3, 19, 20]. Building on this prior research, we conducted a retrospective infoveillance study with an unsupervised machine learning approach using natural language processing (NLP) to identify and characterize messages on Twitter posted in the immediate pre and post period of the Indiana outbreak.
